001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.StringReader;
005import java.io.UncheckedIOException;
006import java.lang.System.Logger.Level;
007import java.net.URI;
008import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
009import java.util.ArrayList;
010import java.util.Arrays;
011import java.util.Comparator;
012import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
013import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.Map;
016import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
017import java.util.Objects;
018import java.util.Optional;
019import java.util.Properties;
020import java.util.Set;
021import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
022import java.util.function.BiFunction;
023import java.util.function.Function;
024import java.util.function.Supplier;
025import java.util.regex.Matcher;
026import java.util.regex.Pattern;
027
028import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
029
030import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig.ChangePublisher.ChangeType;
031import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.MutableLogProperties;
032import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.PropertyFunction;
033import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.PropertyGetter;
034import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.PropertyGetter.ChildPropertyGetter;
035import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.PropertyGetter.RequiredPropertyGetter;
036import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.PropertyGetter.RootPropertyGetter;
037import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.RequiredResult;
038import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.Result;
039import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.CaseChanging;
040import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.LogConfigurable;
041
042/**
043 * Provides String based properties like {@link System#getProperty(String)} for default
044 * configuration of logging levels and output. Since Rainbow Gum is configuration agnostic
045 * LogProperties is a simple string key and string value interface to allow almost any
046 * configuration implementation. The only required method to implement is
047 * {@link #valueOrNull(String)} and thus LogProperties is a functional like interface but
048 * using {@link LogProperties#builder()} is preferred so that a
049 * {@linkplain #description(String) description} can be added.
050 * <p>
051 * If a custom {@link LogProperties} is not configured the default RainbowGum uses System
052 * properties.
053 * <p>
054 * The built-in properties to configure RainbowGum are modeled after <a href=
055 * "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/3.1.0/reference/html/features.html#features.logging">
056 * Spring Boot logging </a>
057 * <p>
058 * LogProperties should generally be accessed with the {@link PropertyGetter} and
059 * {@link Property} like-monads which will allow safe <em>programmatic</em> data
060 * conversion of the flat key values and useful error messages to users if the property
061 * cannot be mapped or is missing. For more <em>declarative</em> injection of properties
062 * see {@link LogConfigurable} which will generate builders that can use LogProperties.
063 * <p>
064 * Rainbow Gum treats {@value #SEP} in the keys as special separator analogous to
065 * JavaScript/JSON and various other configuration systems. Furthermore to work with a
066 * wide set of configuration systems once a property key has a value it is
067 * <strong>RECOMMENDED</strong> that there should not be other property key value with a
068 * key that is a prefix of the previously mentioned key. For example allowing two
069 * properties <code>logging.example=stuff</code>, <code>logging.example.a=A</code> is not
070 * recommended as <code>logging.example</code> is defined as a leaf. The exception to this
071 * rule is logging levels mapped to logger names for consistency with Spring Boot.
072 * <p>
073 * A convention used through out Rainbow Gum is to have the property names as constants as
074 * it makes documentation easier. These constants name are suffixed with
075 * <code>_PROPERTY</code> or <code>_PREFIX</code> the former being a fully qualified key
076 * that maybe parameterized and the latter being a partial key ending with
077 * "<code>.</code>". The fully qualified keys are like leaves on a tree.
078 * <p>
079 * Property keys can be parameterized by using
080 * {@link LogProperties#interpolateKey(String, Map)} and a general pattern is
081 * <code>logging.component.{name}.prop</code> where {@value #NAME} is a parameter. Many
082 * property constants use this to allow multiple configuration of components by name.
083 *
084 * <table class="table">
085 * <caption><strong>Built-in Property Patterns</strong></caption>
086 * <tr>
087 * <th>Property Pattern</th>
088 * <th>Description</th>
089 * </tr>
090 * <tr>
091 * <td>{@value #LEVEL_PREFIX} + {@value #SEP} + logger = LEVEL</td>
092 * <td>Sets the level for the logger. If logger name is missing then it is considered the
093 * root logger. {@link Level#INFO} is the default level for the root logger.</td>
094 * </tr>
095 * <tr>
096 * <td>{@value #CHANGE_PREFIX} + {@value #SEP} + logger = boolean |
097 * List&lt;{@link ChangeType}&gt;</td>
098 * <td>Allows runtime changing of levels for the logger. By design RainbowGum does not
099 * allow loggers to change levels once initialized. This configuration will allow the
100 * level to be changed for the logger and its children and by default is false as the
101 * built-in {@link LogProperties} is generally static (system properties).</td>
102 * </tr>
103 * <tr>
104 * <td>{@value #ROUTES_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
105 * <td>A comma separated list of routes that should be enabled. If not set
106 * {@value LogRouter.Router#DEFAULT_ROUTER_NAME } is the default.</td>
107 * </tr>
108 * <tr>
109 * <td>{@value #ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
110 * <td>A comma separated list of appenders associated with the route. If not set
111 * {@value #APPENDERS_PROPERTY} is used.</td>
112 * </tr>
113 * <tr>
114 * <td>{@value #ROUTE_PUBLISHER_PROPERTY} = <code>URI</code></td>
115 * <td>Looks up a publisher by URI scheme using the {@link LogPublisherRegistry}. The
116 * publisher is then configured by properties with {@value #PUBLISHER_PREFIX}.</td>
117 * </tr>
118 * <tr>
119 * <td>{@value #APPENDERS_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
120 * <td>A comma separated list of appenders that should be enabled. If not set
121 * {@value LogAppender#CONSOLE_APPENDER_NAME} is the default.</td>
122 * </tr>
123 * <tr>
124 * <td>{@value #APPENDER_OUTPUT_PROPERTY } = <code>URI</code></td>
125 * <td>Looks up an output by URI scheme using the {@link LogOutputRegistry}. The output is
126 * then configured by properties with {@value #OUTPUT_PREFIX}.</td>
127 * </tr>
128 * <tr>
129 * <td>{@value #APPENDER_ENCODER_PROPERTY } = <code>URI</code></td>
130 * <td>Looks up an encoder by URI scheme using the {@link LogEncoderRegistry}. The encoder
131 * is then configured by properties with {@value #ENCODER_PREFIX}.</td>
132 * </tr>
133 * <tr>
134 * <tr>
135 * <td>{@value #OUTPUT_PREFIX} + <code>propertyName</code></td>
136 * <td>Configures the named output. The name of the output usually comes from the
137 * appender.</td>
138 * </tr>
139 * <tr>
140 * <td>{@value #ENCODER_PREFIX} + <code>propertyName</code></td>
141 * <td>Configures the named encoder. The name of the encoder usually comes from the
142 * appender.</td>
143 * </tr>
144 * <tr>
145 * <td>{@value #FILE_PROPERTY} = URI</td>
146 * <td>A URI or file path to log to a file. This is for Spring Boot compatibility.</td>
147 * </tr>
148 * </table>
149 *
150 * @see LogConfigurable
151 */
152public interface LogProperties {
153
154        /**
155         * properties separator.
156         */
157        static final String SEP = ".";
158
159        /**
160         * Logging properties prefix.
161         */
162        static final String ROOT_PREFIX = "logging" + SEP;
163
164        /**
165         * Logging level properties prefix. The value should be the name of a
166         * {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level level}.
167         */
168        static final String LEVEL_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "level";
169
170        /**
171         * Logging change configuration allowed property.
172         */
173        static final String GLOBAL_CHANGE_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "global.change";
174
175        /**
176         * Will globalally turn of any ANSI escape output as well disable extensions that do
177         * things for ANSI escape like JANSI.
178         */
179        static final String GLOBAL_ANSI_DISABLE_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "global.ansi.disable";
180
181        /**
182         * Logging change properties prefix.
183         */
184        static final String CHANGE_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "change";
185
186        /**
187         * Logging file property for default single file appending. The value should be a URI.
188         */
189        static final String FILE_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "file.name";
190
191        /**
192         * A common key parameter is called name.
193         */
194        static final String NAME = "name";
195
196        /**
197         * Logging output prefix for configuration.
198         */
199        static final String OUTPUT_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "output.{" + NAME + "}.";
200
201        /**
202         * Logging output prefix for configuration.
203         */
204        static final String ENCODER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "encoder.{" + NAME + "}.";
205
206        /**
207         * Enabled Logging appenders. The value should be a list of names. This is equivalent
208         * to {@value #ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY} with name "default".
209         */
210        static final String APPENDERS_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "appenders";
211
212        /**
213         * Logging appender prefix for configuration.
214         */
215        static final String APPENDER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "appender.{" + NAME + "}.";
216
217        /**
218         * Output appender property.
219         */
220        static final String APPENDER_OUTPUT_PROPERTY = LogProperties.APPENDER_PREFIX + "output";
221
222        /**
223         * Encoder appender property.
224         */
225        static final String APPENDER_ENCODER_PROPERTY = LogProperties.APPENDER_PREFIX + "encoder";
226
227        /**
228         * Logging publisher prefix for configuration.
229         */
230        static final String PUBLISHER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "publisher.{" + NAME + "}.";
231
232        /**
233         * Routes enabled with names comma separated.
234         */
235        static final String ROUTES_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "routes";
236
237        /**
238         * Route prefix for configuration.
239         */
240        static final String ROUTE_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "route.{" + NAME + "}.";
241
242        /**
243         * Logging publisher URI property.
244         */
245        static final String ROUTE_PUBLISHER_PROPERTY = ROUTE_PREFIX + "publisher";
246
247        /**
248         * Appenders associated with a route comma separated.
249         */
250        static final String ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY = ROUTE_PREFIX + "appenders";
251
252        /**
253         * Logging level properties prefix. The value should be the name of a
254         * {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level level}.
255         */
256        static final String ROUTE_LEVEL_PREFIX = ROUTE_PREFIX + "level";
257
258        /**
259         * Analogous to {@link System#getProperty(String)}.
260         * @param key property name.
261         * @return property value.
262         */
263        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key);
264
265        /**
266         * Gets a list or null if the key is missing and by default uses
267         * {@link #parseList(String)}. The default implementation will parse the string value
268         * as a list using {@link LogProperties#parseList(String)} but custom implementations
269         * may rely on their own parsing or the data type is built-in to the backing
270         * configuration system.
271         * @param key property name.
272         * @return list or <code>null</code>.
273         * @apiNote the reason empty list is not returned for missing key is that it creates
274         * ambiguity so null is returned when key is missing.
275         */
276        default @Nullable List<String> listOrNull(String key) {
277                String s = valueOrNull(key);
278                if (s == null) {
279                        return null;
280                }
281                return parseList(s);
282        }
283
284        /**
285         * Gets a map or null if the key is missing and by default uses
286         * {@link #parseMap(String)}. The default implementation will parse the string value
287         * as map using {@link LogProperties#parseMap(String)} but custom implementations may
288         * rely on their own parsing or the data type is built-in to the backing configuration
289         * system.
290         * @param key property name.
291         * @return map or <code>null</code>.
292         * @apiNote the reason empty map is not returned for missing key is that it creates
293         * ambiguity so null is returned when key is missing.
294         */
295        default @Nullable Map<String, String> mapOrNull(String key) {
296                String s = valueOrNull(key);
297                if (s == null) {
298                        return null;
299                }
300                return parseMap(s);
301        }
302
303        /**
304         * Searches up a {@value #SEP} separated path using this properties to check for
305         * values.
306         * @param root prefix.
307         * @param key should start with prefix.
308         * @return closest value.
309         * @see #searchPath(String, Function)
310         */
311        default @Nullable String search(String root, String key) {
312                return search(root, key, (p, k) -> p.valueOrNull(k));
313                // return searchPath(key, k -> valueOrNull(concatKey(root, k)));
314
315        }
316
317        /**
318         * Searches up a {@value #SEP} separated path using this properties to check for
319         * values.
320         * @param <T> result type
321         * @param root prefix.
322         * @param key should start with prefix.
323         * @param func convert function
324         * @return closest value.
325         * @see #searchPath(String, Function)
326         */
327        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
328        default <T extends @Nullable Object> @Nullable T search(String root, String key,
329                        BiFunction<LogProperties, String, @Nullable T> func) {
330                return searchPath(key, k -> func.apply(this, concatKey(root, k)));
331        }
332
333        /**
334         * Describes a key and by default is usually just the key.
335         * @param key key.
336         * @return usually the key.
337         */
338        default String description(String key) {
339                return key;
340        }
341
342        /**
343         * When log properties are coalesced this method is used to resolve order. A higher
344         * number gives higher precedence.
345         * @return zero by default.
346         */
347        default int order() {
348                return 0;
349        }
350
351        /**
352         * Abstract log properties builder.
353         *
354         * @param <T> builder.
355         * @apiNote this abstract class can largely be ignored hence why it is sealed.
356         */
357        public sealed abstract class AbstractBuilder<T> {
358
359                /**
360                 * description
361                 */
362                protected @Nullable String description = null;
363
364                /**
365                 * order
366                 */
367                protected int order = 0;
368
369                /**
370                 * rename key
371                 */
372                protected Function<String, String> renameKey = s -> s;
373
374                /**
375                 * fallbacks
376                 */
377                protected List<LogProperties> fallbacks = new ArrayList<>();
378
379                /**
380                 * Ignored.
381                 */
382                protected AbstractBuilder() {
383                }
384
385                /**
386                 * Add a fallback properties.
387                 * @param properties fallback not null.
388                 * @return this.
389                 */
390                public T from(LogProperties properties) {
391                        this.fallbacks.add(properties);
392                        return self();
393                }
394
395                /**
396                 * For returning this.
397                 * @return this builder.
398                 */
399                protected abstract T self();
400
401                /**
402                 * Description for properties.
403                 * @param description not null.
404                 * @return this.
405                 */
406                public T description(String description) {
407                        this.description = description;
408                        return self();
409                }
410
411                /**
412                 * When log properties are coalesced this method is used to resolve order. A
413                 * higher number gives higher precedence.
414                 * @param order order.
415                 * @return this.
416                 */
417                public T order(int order) {
418                        this.order = order;
419                        return self();
420                }
421
422                /**
423                 * Renames the key before it accesses function.
424                 * @param renameKey rename key function.
425                 * @return this.
426                 */
427                public T renameKey(Function<String, String> renameKey) {
428                        this.renameKey = renameKey;
429                        return self();
430                }
431
432                enum Format {
433
434                        PROPERTIES() {
435                                @Override
436                                Map<String, String> toMap(String content) {
437                                        var m = new LinkedHashMap<String, String>();
438                                        StringReader reader = new StringReader(content);
439                                        try {
440                                                PropertiesParser.readProperties(reader, m::put);
441                                        }
442                                        catch (IOException e) {
443                                                throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
444                                        }
445                                        return m;
446                                }
447                        },
448                        URI_QUERY() {
449                                @Override
450                                Map<String, String> toMap(String content) {
451                                        return parseMap(content);
452                                }
453                        };
454
455                        abstract Map<String, String> toMap(String content);
456
457                        Function<String, @Nullable String> parse(String content) {
458                                return toMap(content)::get;
459                        }
460
461                }
462
463        }
464
465        /**
466         * Builder for properties.
467         */
468        public final static class Builder extends AbstractBuilder<Builder> {
469
470                private @Nullable Function<String, @Nullable String> function = null;
471
472                private Builder() {
473                }
474
475                @Override
476                protected Builder self() {
477                        return this;
478                }
479
480                /**
481                 * Sets what is called on {@link LogProperties#valueOrNull(String)}.
482                 * @param function valueOrNull func.
483                 * @return this.
484                 */
485                public Builder function(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Function<String, @Nullable String> function) {
486                        this.function = function;
487                        return this;
488                }
489
490                /**
491                 * Parses a string as {@link Properties}.
492                 * @param properties properties as a string.
493                 * @return this.
494                 */
495                public Builder fromProperties(String properties) {
496                        function = Format.PROPERTIES.parse(properties);
497                        if (description == null) {
498                                description = "Properties String";
499                        }
500                        return this;
501                }
502
503                /**
504                 * Parses a string as a URI query string.
505                 * @param query uri percent encoded uri with separator as "<code>&amp;</code>" and
506                 * key value separator of "<code>=</code>".
507                 * @return this.
508                 */
509                public Builder fromURIQuery(String query) {
510                        function = Format.URI_QUERY.parse(query);
511                        return this;
512                }
513
514                /**
515                 * Parses a string as a URI query string. If the URI has no query portion then it
516                 * will be equivalent to empty properties.
517                 * @param uri percent encoded uri with separator as "<code>&amp;</code>" and key
518                 * value separator of "<code>=</code>".
519                 * @return this.
520                 */
521                public Builder fromURIQuery(URI uri) {
522                        String query = uri.getRawQuery();
523                        if (query == null) {
524                                query = "";
525                        }
526                        if (description == null) {
527                                description = "URI('" + uri + "')";
528                        }
529                        function = Format.URI_QUERY.parse(query);
530                        return this;
531                }
532
533                /**
534                 * Builds LogProperties based on builder config.
535                 * @return this.
536                 */
537                public LogProperties build() {
538                        var f = this.function;
539                        if (f == null) {
540                                if (!fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
541                                        return LogProperties.of(fallbacks);
542                                }
543                                throw new IllegalStateException("function is was not set");
544                        }
545                        String description = this.description;
546                        if (description == null) {
547                                description = "custom";
548                        }
549                        var first = new DefaultLogProperties(f, description, renameKey, order);
550                        if (fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
551                                return first;
552                        }
553                        List<LogProperties> combined = new ArrayList<>();
554                        combined.add(first);
555                        combined.addAll(fallbacks);
556                        return LogProperties.of(combined);
557                }
558
559                static abstract class AbstractLogProperties implements LogProperties {
560
561                        protected final String description;
562
563                        protected final Function<String, String> renameKey;
564
565                        protected final int order;
566
567                        public AbstractLogProperties(String description, Function<String, String> renameKey, int order) {
568                                super();
569                                this.description = description;
570                                this.renameKey = renameKey;
571                                this.order = order;
572                        }
573
574                        @Override
575                        public int order() {
576                                return this.order;
577                        }
578
579                        @Override
580                        public String description(String key) {
581                                String rename = renameKey.apply(key);
582                                String desc = "'" + key + "' from " + description;
583                                if (!rename.equals(key)) {
584                                        desc += "[" + rename + "]";
585                                }
586                                return desc;
587                        }
588
589                        @Override
590                        public String toString() {
591                                return getClass().getSimpleName() + "[description='" + description + "', " + "order=" + order + "]";
592                        }
593
594                }
595
596                private static final class DefaultLogProperties extends AbstractLogProperties {
597
598                        private final Function<String, @Nullable String> func;
599
600                        public DefaultLogProperties(Function<String, @Nullable String> func, String description,
601                                        Function<String, String> renameKey, int order) {
602                                super(description, renameKey, order);
603                                this.func = func;
604                        }
605
606                        @Override
607                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
608                                return func.apply(renameKey.apply(key));
609                        }
610
611                }
612
613        }
614
615        /**
616         * A log properties that can be mutated like a map.
617         */
618        public interface MutableLogProperties extends LogProperties {
619
620                /**
621                 * Assigns key to a value.
622                 * @param key key.
623                 * @param value value if null will remove the key.
624                 * @return this.
625                 */
626                MutableLogProperties put(String key, @Nullable String value);
627
628                /**
629                 * Copy Java Util {@link Properties} String useful for unit testing.
630                 * @param content string in {@link Properties} format (tip use multiline strings).
631                 * @return this.
632                 */
633                default MutableLogProperties copyProperties(String content) {
634                        var m = AbstractBuilder.Format.PROPERTIES.toMap(content);
635                        for (var e : m.entrySet()) {
636                                put(e.getKey(), e.getKey());
637                        }
638                        return this;
639                }
640
641                /**
642                 * Builder for MutableLogProperties.
643                 * @return builder.
644                 */
645                public static Builder builder() {
646                        return new Builder();
647                }
648
649                /**
650                 * Mutable Log properties builer.
651                 */
652                public final class Builder extends AbstractBuilder<Builder> {
653
654                        private Map<String, String> map = new LinkedHashMap<>();
655
656                        private Builder() {
657                        }
658
659                        @Override
660                        protected Builder self() {
661                                return this;
662                        }
663
664                        /**
665                         * Sets the backing mutable map.
666                         * @param map backing map.
667                         * @return this.
668                         */
669                        public Builder with(Map<String, String> map) {
670                                this.map = map;
671                                return this;
672                        }
673
674                        /**
675                         * Parses a string as {@link Properties} useful for unit testing with Java
676                         * multiline string literal.
677                         * @param properties properties as a string.
678                         * @return this.
679                         */
680                        public Builder copyProperties(String properties) {
681                                map.putAll(Format.PROPERTIES.toMap(properties));
682                                return this;
683                        }
684
685                        /**
686                         * Builds a mutable log properties.
687                         * @return mutable log properties.
688                         */
689                        public MutableLogProperties build() {
690                                String description = this.description;
691                                if (description == null) {
692                                        description = "custom mutable";
693                                }
694                                var first = new MapLogProperties(map, description, renameKey, order);
695                                if (fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
696                                        return first;
697                                }
698                                List<LogProperties> combined = new ArrayList<>();
699                                combined.add(first);
700                                combined.addAll(fallbacks);
701                                return new CompositeMutableLogProperties(sort(combined));
702                        }
703
704                        private static final class MapLogProperties extends LogProperties.Builder.AbstractLogProperties
705                                        implements MutableLogProperties {
706
707                                private final Map<String, String> map;
708
709                                public MapLogProperties(Map<String, String> map, String description, Function<String, String> renameKey,
710                                                int order) {
711                                        super(description, renameKey, order);
712                                        this.map = map;
713                                }
714
715                                @Override
716                                public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
717                                        return map.get(renameKey.apply(key));
718                                }
719
720                                @Override
721                                public MutableLogProperties put(String key, @Nullable String value) {
722                                        Objects.requireNonNull(key);
723                                        key = renameKey.apply(key);
724                                        if (value == null) {
725                                                map.remove(key);
726                                                return this;
727                                        }
728                                        map.put(key, value);
729                                        return this;
730                                }
731
732                        }
733
734                }
735
736        }
737
738        /**
739         * LogProperties builder.
740         * @return builder.
741         */
742        public static Builder builder() {
743                return new Builder();
744        }
745
746        /**
747         * Creates log properties from many log properties.
748         * @param logProperties list of properties.
749         * @param fallback if the logProperties list is empty.
750         * @return log properties
751         */
752        public static LogProperties of(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties, LogProperties fallback) {
753                if (logProperties.isEmpty()) {
754                        return fallback;
755                }
756                if (logProperties.size() == 0) {
757                        return Objects.requireNonNull(logProperties.get(0));
758                }
759                var array = sort(logProperties);
760                return new CompositeLogProperties(array);
761        }
762
763        private static LogProperties[] sort(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties) {
764                @SuppressWarnings("null") // TODO eclipse array issue
765                LogProperties[] array = logProperties.stream()
766                        .filter(p -> p != StandardProperties.EMPTY)
767                        .toArray(size -> new LogProperties[size]);
768                Arrays.sort(array, Comparator.comparingInt(LogProperties::order).reversed());
769                return array;
770        }
771
772        /**
773         * Creates log properties from many log properties.
774         * @param logProperties the list of properties.
775         * @return if the logProperties is empty {@link StandardProperties#EMPTY} will be
776         * used.
777         */
778        public static LogProperties of(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties) {
779                return of(logProperties, StandardProperties.EMPTY);
780        }
781
782        /**
783         * Creates log properties from a URI query and provided properties. This is useful for
784         * URI based providers where the URI query is contributing properties for the plugin.
785         * @param uri query will be used to pull properties from using
786         * {@link #parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)}.
787         * @param prefix part of the key that will stripped before accessing the URI
788         * properties.
789         * @param properties usually this is the properties coming from {@link LogConfig}.
790         * @return combined properties where properties is tried first than the URI query
791         * parameters.
792         */
793        public static LogProperties of(URI uri, String prefix, LogProperties properties) {
794                String query = uri.getRawQuery();
795                query = query == null ? "" : query;
796                var uriProperties = LogProperties.builder()
797                        .fromURIQuery(query)
798                        .renameKey(s -> LogProperties.removeKeyPrefix(s, prefix))
799                        .build();
800                return LogProperties.of(List.of(properties, uriProperties));
801        }
802
803        /**
804         * Parse a {@linkplain URI#getRawQuery() URI query} in <a href=
805         * "https://www.w3.org/TR/2014/REC-html5-20141028/forms.html#url-encoded-form-data">
806         * application/x-www-form-urlencoded </a> format useful for parsing properties values
807         * that have key values embedded in them. <strong>This parser unlike form encoding
808         * uses <code>%20</code> for space as the data is coming from a URI.</strong>
809         * @param query raw query component of URI.
810         * @param consumer accept will be called for each entry and if key (left hand) does
811         * not have a "<code>=</code>" following it the second parameter on the consumer
812         * accept will be passed <code>null</code>.
813         */
814        public static void parseUriQuery(String query,
815                        @SuppressWarnings("exports") BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
816                parseUriQuery(query, true, consumer);
817        }
818
819        /**
820         * Parses a URI query formatted string to a Map.
821         * @param query raw query component of URI.
822         * @return decoded key values with last key winning over previous equal keys.
823         * @see #parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)
824         */
825        public static Map<String, String> parseMap(String query) {
826                Map<String, String> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
827                parseUriQuery(query, (k, v) -> {
828                        if (v != null) {
829                                m.put(k, v);
830                        }
831                });
832                return m;
833        }
834
835        /**
836         * Parses a URI query for a multiple value map. The list values of the map maybe empty
837         * if the query parameter does not have any values associated with it which would be
838         * the case if there is a parameter (key) with no "<code>=</code>" following it. For
839         * example the following would have three entries of <code>a,b,c</code> all with empty
840         * list: <pre>
841         * <code>
842         * a&amp;b&amp;c&amp;
843         * </code> </pre>
844         * @param query raw query component of URI.
845         * @return decoded key values with multiple keys grouped together in order found.
846         */
847        public static Map<String, List<String>> parseMultiMap(String query) {
848                Map<String, List<String>> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
849                BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> f = (k, v) -> {
850                        List<String> list = Objects.requireNonNull(m.computeIfAbsent(k, _k -> new ArrayList<String>()));
851                        if (v != null) {
852                                list.add(v);
853                        }
854                };
855                parseUriQuery(query, true, f);
856                return m;
857        }
858
859        /**
860         * Parses a list of strings from a string that is <a href=
861         * "https://www.w3.org/TR/2014/REC-html5-20141028/forms.html#url-encoded-form-data">
862         * percent encoded for escaping (application/x-www-form-urlencoded)</a> where the
863         * separator can be either "<code>&amp;</code>" or "<code>,</code>".
864         * <p>
865         * An example would be using ampersand: <pre><code>
866         *  "a&amp;b%20B&amp;c" -> ["a","b B","c"]
867         *  </code> </pre> and comma: <pre><code>
868         *  "a,b,c" -> ["a","b","c"]
869         *  </code> </pre>
870         * @param query the comma or ampersand delimited string that is in URI query format.
871         * @return list of strings
872         */
873        public static List<String> parseList(String query) {
874                List<String> list = new ArrayList<>();
875                parseUriQuery(query, true, "[&,]", (k, v) -> list.add(k));
876                return list;
877        }
878
879        private static void parseUriQuery(String query, boolean decode, BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
880                parseUriQuery(query, decode, "&", consumer);
881        }
882
883        private static void parseUriQuery(String query, boolean decode, String sep,
884                        BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
885                /*
886                 * TODO default java split has issues but is very fast
887                 */
888                @SuppressWarnings("StringSplitter")
889                String[] pairs = query.split(sep);
890                for (String pair : pairs) {
891                        int idx = pair.indexOf("=");
892                        String key;
893                        String value;
894                        if (idx == 0) {
895                                continue;
896                        }
897                        else if (idx < 0) {
898                                key = pair;
899                                value = null;
900                        }
901                        else {
902                                key = pair.substring(0, idx);
903                                value = pair.substring(idx + 1);
904                        }
905                        if (decode) {
906                                key = PercentCodec.decode(key, StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
907                                if (value != null) {
908                                        value = PercentCodec.decode(value, StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
909                                }
910
911                        }
912                        if (key.isBlank()) {
913                                continue;
914                        }
915                        consumer.accept(key, value);
916                }
917        }
918
919        /**
920         * Common static log properties such as System properties ane environment variables.
921         */
922        @CaseChanging
923        enum StandardProperties implements LogProperties {
924
925                /**
926                 * Empty properties. The order is <code>-1</code>.
927                 */
928                EMPTY {
929                        @Override
930                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
931                                return null;
932                        }
933
934                        @Override
935                        public int order() {
936                                return -1;
937                        }
938                },
939                /**
940                 * Uses {@link System#getProperty(String)} for {@link #valueOrNull(String)}. The
941                 * {@link #order()} is <code>400</code> which the same value as MicroProfile
942                 * config ordinal.
943                 */
944                SYSTEM_PROPERTIES {
945                        @Override
946                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
947                                return System.getProperty(key);
948                        }
949
950                        @Override
951                        public int order() {
952                                return 400;
953                        }
954                },
955                /**
956                 * Uses {@link System#getenv(String)} for {@link #valueOrNull(String)}.The
957                 * {@link #order()} is <code>300</code> which is the same value as MicroProfile
958                 * config ordinal.
959                 */
960                ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLES {
961                        @Override
962                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
963                                return System.getenv(translateKey(key));
964                        }
965
966                        @Override
967                        protected String translateKey(String key) {
968                                return key.replace(".", "_");
969                        }
970
971                };
972
973                @Override
974                public String description(String key) {
975                        String k = translateKey(key);
976                        String description = "'" + key + "' from " + name();
977                        if (!k.equals(key)) {
978                                description += "[" + k + "]";
979                        }
980                        return description;
981                }
982
983                /**
984                 * Translate the key.
985                 * @param key input
986                 * @return output
987                 */
988                protected String translateKey(String key) {
989                        return key;
990                }
991
992        }
993
994        /**
995         * An error friendly {@link Function} for converting properties.
996         *
997         * @param <T> input type.
998         * @param <R> output type.
999         * @param <E> error type.
1000         */
1001        public interface PropertyFunction<T extends @Nullable Object, R extends @Nullable Object, E extends Exception>
1002                        extends Function<T, R> {
1003
1004                @Override
1005                default R apply(T t) {
1006                        try {
1007                                return _apply(t);
1008                        }
1009                        catch (Exception e) {
1010                                sneakyThrow(e);
1011                                throw new RuntimeException(e);
1012                        }
1013                }
1014
1015                /**
1016                 * Apply that throws error.
1017                 * @param t input
1018                 * @return output
1019                 * @throws E if an error happened in function.
1020                 */
1021                public R _apply(T t) throws E;
1022
1023                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1024                private static <E extends Throwable> void sneakyThrow(final Throwable x) throws E {
1025                        throw (E) x;
1026                }
1027
1028        }
1029
1030        /**
1031         * Parent interface for property exceptions.
1032         */
1033        sealed interface PropertyProblem {
1034
1035        }
1036
1037        /**
1038         * Thrown if an error happens while converting a property.
1039         */
1040        final static class PropertyConvertException extends RuntimeException implements PropertyProblem {
1041
1042                private static final long serialVersionUID = -6260241455268426342L;
1043
1044                /**
1045                 * Key.
1046                 */
1047                private final String key;
1048
1049                /**
1050                 * Creates convert exception.
1051                 * @param key property key.
1052                 * @param message error message
1053                 * @param cause maybe null.
1054                 */
1055                PropertyConvertException(String key, String message, @Nullable Throwable cause) {
1056                        super(message, cause);
1057                        this.key = key;
1058                }
1059
1060                /**
1061                 * Property key.
1062                 * @return key.
1063                 */
1064                public String key() {
1065                        return this.key;
1066                }
1067
1068        }
1069
1070        /**
1071         * Throw if property is missing.
1072         */
1073        final static class PropertyMissingException extends NoSuchElementException implements PropertyProblem {
1074
1075                private static final long serialVersionUID = 4203076848052565692L;
1076
1077                /**
1078                 * Creates a missing property exception.
1079                 * @param s error message.
1080                 */
1081                PropertyMissingException(String s) {
1082                        super(s);
1083                }
1084
1085        }
1086
1087        /**
1088         * Searches a {@value LogProperties#SEP} separated property path recursing up the path
1089         * till a non null value (not missing) is found.
1090         * <p>
1091         * For example assume we have a single property set like
1092         * <code>logging.level.com.stuff=DEBUG</code> and we call this function with
1093         * <code>logging.level.com.stuff.a.b</code>.
1094         * <ol>
1095         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff.a.b</code> will resolve to <code>null</code></li>
1096         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff.a</code> will resolve to <code>null</code></li>
1097         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff</code> will resolve to <code>"DEBUG"</code>, stop
1098         * and return <code>"DEBUG"</code>.</li>
1099         * </ol>
1100         * @param <T> type to return.
1101         * @param key the initial path.
1102         * @param resolveFunc function that returns the value at path or <code>null</code>.
1103         * @return value or <code>null</code>.
1104         */
1105        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
1106        public static <T extends @Nullable Object> @Nullable T searchPath(String key,
1107                        Function<String, @Nullable T> resolveFunc) {
1108                return searchPath(key, resolveFunc, SEP);
1109        }
1110
1111        private static <T> @Nullable T searchPath(String key, Function<String, @Nullable T> resolveFunc, String sep) {
1112                String tempName = key;
1113                @Nullable
1114                T level = null;
1115                int indexOfLastDot = tempName.length();
1116                while ((level == null) && (indexOfLastDot > -1)) {
1117                        tempName = tempName.substring(0, indexOfLastDot);
1118                        level = resolveFunc.apply(tempName);
1119                        indexOfLastDot = tempName.lastIndexOf(sep);
1120                }
1121                if (level != null) {
1122                        return level;
1123                }
1124                return resolveFunc.apply("");
1125        }
1126
1127        /**
1128         * Concats a key using {@link #SEP} to the root prefix.
1129         * @param name key.
1130         * @return concat key.
1131         */
1132        static String concatKey(String name) {
1133                return concatKey(LogProperties.ROOT_PREFIX, name);
1134        }
1135
1136        /**
1137         * Concats a keys using {@link #SEP} as the separator.
1138         * @param prefix start of key.
1139         * @param name second part of key.
1140         * @return key.
1141         */
1142        static String concatKey(String prefix, String name) {
1143                if (name.equals("")) {
1144                        return prefix;
1145                }
1146                if (prefix.equals("")) {
1147                        return name;
1148                }
1149                if (prefix.endsWith(".")) {
1150                        prefix = prefix.substring(0, prefix.length() - 1);
1151                }
1152                if (name.startsWith(SEP)) {
1153                        return prefix + name;
1154                }
1155                return prefix + SEP + name;
1156        }
1157
1158        /**
1159         * Replace "{name}" tokens in property names.
1160         * @param key property name.
1161         * @param parameters tokens to replace with entry values.
1162         * @return interpolated property key.
1163         */
1164        static String interpolateKey(String key, Map<String, String> parameters) {
1165                for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : parameters.entrySet()) {
1166                        key = key.replace("{" + entry.getKey() + "}", entry.getValue());
1167                }
1168                return key;
1169        }
1170
1171        /**
1172         * Interpolates a named key which is a property key that has a {@value #NAME}.
1173         * @param key with name parameters.
1174         * @param name replace name token.
1175         * @return interpolated property key.
1176         */
1177        static String interpolateNamedKey(String key, String name) {
1178                return interpolateKey(key, Map.of(NAME, name));
1179        }
1180
1181        /**
1182         * Remove key prefix from the key. Prefix should end in "." but this method does not
1183         * check that.
1184         * @param key key whose prefix will be removed.
1185         * @param prefix property name prefix.
1186         * @return prefix removed if the string is prefixed.
1187         */
1188        static String removeKeyPrefix(String key, String prefix) {
1189                if (key.startsWith(prefix)) {
1190                        return key.substring(prefix.length());
1191                }
1192                return key;
1193        }
1194
1195        /**
1196         * Property prefix parameter pattern.
1197         */
1198        static final Pattern PARAMETER_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("\\{(.*?)\\}");
1199
1200        /**
1201         * Extract key parameters with {@link #PARAMETER_PATTERN}.
1202         * @param key also known as property name.
1203         * @return parameters in key.
1204         */
1205        static Set<String> keyParameters(String key) {
1206                Set<String> tokens = new LinkedHashSet<>();
1207                Matcher matcher = PARAMETER_PATTERN.matcher(key);
1208                while (matcher.find()) {
1209                        var t = matcher.group(1);
1210                        if (t == null) {
1211                                throw new IllegalStateException("bug with parameter pattern regex.");
1212                        }
1213                        tokens.add(t);
1214                }
1215                return tokens;
1216        }
1217
1218        private static void validateKeyParameters(String key, Set<String> parameters) {
1219                var keyParameters = keyParameters(key);
1220                if (!parameters.equals(keyParameters)) {
1221                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Keyed parameter mismatch. key is parameters: " + keyParameters
1222                                        + " provided parameters: " + parameters);
1223                }
1224        }
1225
1226        /**
1227         * The result of a property fetched from properties.
1228         *
1229         * @param <T> property type.
1230         */
1231        sealed interface Result<T> {
1232
1233                /**
1234                 * Gets the value.
1235                 * @return value or <code>null</code>.
1236                 */
1237                public @Nullable T valueOrNull();
1238
1239                /**
1240                 * Gets a value if there is if not uses the fallback.
1241                 * @param fallback maybe <code>null</code>.
1242                 * @return value.
1243                 */
1244                default @Nullable T valueOrNull(@Nullable T fallback) {
1245                        var v = valueOrNull();
1246                        if (v != null) {
1247                                return v;
1248                        }
1249                        return fallback;
1250                }
1251
1252                /**
1253                 * Gets the value and will fail with {@link NoSuchElementException} if there is no
1254                 * value.
1255                 * @return value.
1256                 * @throws PropertyMissingException if there is no value.
1257                 * @throws PropertyConvertException if the property failed conversion.
1258                 */
1259                public T value() throws PropertyMissingException, PropertyConvertException;
1260
1261                /**
1262                 * Gets a value if there if not uses the fallback if not null otherwise throws an
1263                 * exception.
1264                 * @param fallback maybe <code>null</code>.
1265                 * @return value.
1266                 * @throws PropertyMissingException if no property and fallback is
1267                 * <code>null</code>.
1268                 * @throws PropertyConvertException if the property failed conversion.
1269                 */
1270                default T value(@Nullable T fallback) throws PropertyMissingException, PropertyConvertException {
1271                        if (fallback == null) {
1272                                return value();
1273                        }
1274                        return value(() -> fallback);
1275                }
1276
1277                /**
1278                 * Gets a value if there if not uses the fallback if not null otherwise throws an
1279                 * exception.
1280                 * @param fallback maybe <code>null</code>.
1281                 * @return value.
1282                 * @throws PropertyMissingException if no property and fallback is
1283                 * <code>null</code>.
1284                 * @throws PropertyConvertException if the property failed conversion.
1285                 */
1286                public T value(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Supplier<? extends @Nullable T> fallback)
1287                                throws PropertyMissingException, PropertyConvertException;
1288
1289                /**
1290                 * Convenience that turns a value into an optional.
1291                 * @return optional.
1292                 */
1293                default Optional<T> optional() {
1294                        return Optional.ofNullable(valueOrNull());
1295                }
1296
1297                /**
1298                 * A property that is present.
1299                 *
1300                 * @param <T> property type.
1301                 * @param value actual value.
1302                 */
1303                public record Success<T>(T value) implements RequiredResult<T> {
1304                        /**
1305                         * Succesfully found property value.
1306                         * @param value actual value should not be <code>null</code>.
1307                         */
1308                        public Success {
1309                                if (value == null) {
1310                                        throw new NullPointerException("value");
1311                                }
1312                        }
1313
1314                        @Override
1315                        public @Nullable T valueOrNull() {
1316                                return value();
1317                        }
1318
1319                        @Override
1320                        public T value(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Supplier<? extends @Nullable T> fallback)
1321                                        throws NoSuchElementException {
1322                                return value;
1323                        }
1324                }
1325
1326                /**
1327                 * A property that is missing (<code>null</code>).
1328                 *
1329                 * @param <T> property type.
1330                 * @param message description of where the property is missing.
1331                 */
1332                public record Missing<T>(String message) implements Result<T> {
1333                        @Override
1334                        public @Nullable T valueOrNull() {
1335                                return null;
1336                        }
1337
1338                        @Override
1339                        public T value() throws NoSuchElementException {
1340                                throw new PropertyMissingException(message);
1341                        }
1342
1343                        @Override
1344                        public T value(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Supplier<? extends @Nullable T> fallback)
1345                                        throws NoSuchElementException {
1346                                var v = fallback.get();
1347                                if (v != null) {
1348                                        return v;
1349                                }
1350                                throw new PropertyMissingException(message);
1351                        }
1352
1353                        /**
1354                         * Helper just to cast the result to a different parameterized type.
1355                         * @param <R> parameterized type.
1356                         * @return this.
1357                         */
1358                        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1359                        public <R> Missing<R> convert() {
1360                                return (Missing<R>) this;
1361                        }
1362
1363                }
1364
1365                /**
1366                 * A property that was present but failed conversion.
1367                 *
1368                 * @param <T> property type.
1369                 * @param key property key that failed to convert.
1370                 * @param message failure message.
1371                 * @param cause exception thrown while trying to convert.
1372                 */
1373                @SuppressWarnings("JavaLangClash")
1374                public record Error<T>(String key, String message, Exception cause) implements RequiredResult<T> {
1375                        /*
1376                         * TODO consider rename to Failure
1377                         */
1378                        @Override
1379                        public @Nullable T valueOrNull() {
1380                                throw new PropertyConvertException(key, message, cause);
1381                        }
1382
1383                        @Override
1384                        public T value() throws NoSuchElementException {
1385                                throw new PropertyConvertException(key, message, cause);
1386                        }
1387
1388                        @Override
1389                        public T value(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Supplier<? extends @Nullable T> fallback)
1390                                        throws NoSuchElementException {
1391                                throw new PropertyConvertException(key, message, cause);
1392                        }
1393
1394                        /**
1395                         * Helper just to cast the result to a different parameterized type.
1396                         * @param <R> parameterized type.
1397                         * @return this.
1398                         */
1399                        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1400                        public <R> Error<R> convert() {
1401                                return (Error<R>) this;
1402                        }
1403                }
1404
1405        }
1406
1407        /**
1408         * A result that is not missing and will either be an error or success.
1409         *
1410         * @param <T> property type.
1411         */
1412        sealed interface RequiredResult<T> extends Result<T> {
1413
1414        }
1415
1416        /**
1417         * A property description that can retrieve a property result by being passed
1418         * {@link LogProperties}. <em>The property instance does not actually contain the
1419         * value of the property!</em>.
1420         *
1421         * @param <T> property type.
1422         * @see RequiredProperty
1423         * @see Result
1424         */
1425        sealed interface Property<T> {
1426
1427                /**
1428                 * Gets the first key.
1429                 * @return key.
1430                 */
1431                public String key();
1432
1433                /**
1434                 * Gets a property value as a result.
1435                 * @param properties key values.
1436                 * @return result.
1437                 */
1438                public Result<T> get(LogProperties properties);
1439
1440                /**
1441                 * Maps the property to another value type.
1442                 * @param <U> value type.
1443                 * @param mapper function to map.
1444                 * @return property.
1445                 */
1446                public <U> Property<U> map(PropertyFunction<? super T, ? extends U, ? super Exception> mapper);
1447
1448                /**
1449                 * Converts the value into a String that can be parsed by the built-in properties
1450                 * parsing of types. Supported types: String, Boolean, Integer, URI, Map, List.
1451                 * @param value to be converted to string.
1452                 * @return property representation of value.
1453                 */
1454                public String propertyString(T value);
1455
1456                /**
1457                 * Set a property if its not null.
1458                 * @param value value to set.
1459                 * @param consumer first parameter is first key and second parameter is non null
1460                 * value.
1461                 */
1462                public void set(T value, BiConsumer<String, T> consumer);
1463
1464                /**
1465                 * Programmatically check if a value that corresponds to this property is not
1466                 * null.
1467                 * @param value maybe <code>null</code> but an exception will be thrown if it is.
1468                 * @return value if not null.
1469                 * @throws NoSuchElementException if the value is null.
1470                 * @apiNote this is an expected exception and should not be treated as crash-able
1471                 * exception that should avoided with static analysis such as Checker Framework
1472                 * and is why the input argument is nullable.
1473                 */
1474                default T require(@Nullable T value) {
1475                        if (value == null) {
1476                                throw new PropertyMissingException("Value is required not null. property key='" + key() + "'");
1477                        }
1478                        return value;
1479                }
1480
1481                /**
1482                 * Builder.
1483                 * @return builder.
1484                 */
1485                public static RootPropertyGetter builder() {
1486                        return PropertyGetter.of();
1487                }
1488
1489        }
1490
1491        /**
1492         * A property that should never be missing usually because there is non-null fallback.
1493         *
1494         * @param <T> property type.
1495         */
1496        sealed interface RequiredProperty<T> extends Property<T> {
1497
1498                /**
1499                 * Gets a property value as a result.
1500                 * @param properties key values.
1501                 * @return result.
1502                 */
1503                @Override
1504                public RequiredResult<T> get(LogProperties properties);
1505
1506                /**
1507                 * Maps the property to another value type.
1508                 * @param <U> value type.
1509                 * @param mapper function to map.
1510                 * @return property.
1511                 */
1512                @Override
1513                public <U> RequiredProperty<U> map(PropertyFunction<? super T, ? extends U, ? super Exception> mapper);
1514
1515        }
1516
1517        /**
1518         * Extracts and converts from {@link LogProperties} and is also an immutable builder
1519         * for {@link Property}s.
1520         *
1521         * @param <T> value type.
1522         */
1523        sealed interface PropertyGetter<T> {
1524
1525                /**
1526                 * Gets a result from properties.
1527                 * @param props properties.
1528                 * @param key property key usually dotted.
1529                 * @return result.
1530                 */
1531                Result<T> get(LogProperties props, String key);
1532
1533                /**
1534                 * Gets a result from properties by trying a list of keys.
1535                 * @param props properties.
1536                 * @param keys list of property keys usually dotted.
1537                 * @return result.
1538                 */
1539                default Result<T> get(LogProperties props, List<String> keys) {
1540                        for (String key : keys) {
1541                                var r = get(props, key);
1542                                @SuppressWarnings("null") // TODO eclipse bug
1543                                @Nullable
1544                                Result<T> found = switch (r) {
1545                                        case Result.Success<T> s -> s;
1546                                        case Result.Error<T> s -> s;
1547                                        case Result.Missing<T> s -> null;
1548                                };
1549                                if (found != null) {
1550                                        return found;
1551                                }
1552                        }
1553                        return findRoot(this).missingResult(props, keys);
1554                }
1555
1556                /**
1557                 * Converts the value into a String that can be parsed by the built-in properties
1558                 * parsing of types. Supported types: String, Boolean, Integer, URI, Map, List.
1559                 * @param value to be converted to string.
1560                 * @return property representation of value.
1561                 */
1562                String propertyString(T value);
1563
1564                /**
1565                 * Determines full name of key.
1566                 * @param key key.
1567                 * @return fully qualified key name.
1568                 */
1569                default String fullyQualifiedKey(String key) {
1570                        return findRoot(this).fullyQualifiedKey(key);
1571                }
1572
1573                /**
1574                 * Validates the key is correctly prefixed.
1575                 * @param key dotted key.
1576                 */
1577                default void validateKey(String key) {
1578                        String fqn = fullyQualifiedKey(key);
1579                        if (!fqn.startsWith(LogProperties.ROOT_PREFIX)) {
1580                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1581                                                "Property key should start with: '" + LogProperties.ROOT_PREFIX + "'. key = " + key);
1582                        }
1583                        if (fqn.endsWith(".") || fqn.startsWith(".")) {
1584                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1585                                                "Property key should not start or end with '" + LogProperties.SEP + "'");
1586                        }
1587                        validateKeyParameters(key, Set.of());
1588                }
1589
1590                /**
1591                 * Creates a Property from the given key and this getter.
1592                 * @param key key.
1593                 * @return property.
1594                 * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the key is malformed.
1595                 */
1596                default Property<T> build(String key) throws IllegalArgumentException {
1597                        validateKey(key);
1598                        return new DefaultProperty<>(this, List.of(key));
1599                }
1600
1601                /**
1602                 * Creates a Property from the given key and its {@value LogProperties#NAME}
1603                 * parameter.
1604                 * @param key key.
1605                 * @param name interpolates <code>{name}</code> in property name with this value.
1606                 * @return property.
1607                 */
1608                default Property<T> buildWithName(String key, String name) {
1609                        var parameters = Map.of(NAME, name);
1610                        validateKeyParameters(key, parameters.keySet());
1611                        String fqn = LogProperties.interpolateKey(key, parameters);
1612                        return build(fqn);
1613                }
1614
1615                /**
1616                 * Find root property getter.
1617                 * @param e property getter.
1618                 * @return root.
1619                 */
1620                @SuppressWarnings("null") // TODO eclipse bug
1621                public static RootPropertyGetter findRoot(PropertyGetter<?> e) {
1622                        return switch (e) {
1623                                case RootPropertyGetter r -> r;
1624                                case ChildPropertyGetter<?> c -> findRoot(c.parent());
1625                        };
1626                }
1627
1628                /**
1629                 * Default root property getter.
1630                 * @return property getter.
1631                 */
1632                public static RootPropertyGetter of() {
1633                        return new RootPropertyGetter("", false);
1634                }
1635
1636                /**
1637                 * A property getter and <strong>builder</strong> that has no conversion but may
1638                 * prefix the key and search recursively up the key path.
1639                 * <p>
1640                 * While you can map the string properties with {@link #map(PropertyFunction)} it
1641                 * is preferred to use the <code>to</code> methods on this class for basic types
1642                 * especially for list or map types as the implementation will call the
1643                 * implementation specific in LogProperties. An example is {@link #toMap()} which
1644                 * will call the LogProperties implementation of
1645                 * {@link LogProperties#mapOrNull(String)}.
1646                 *
1647                 * @param prefix added to the key before looking up in {@link LogProperties}.
1648                 * @param search if true will recursively search up the key path
1649                 */
1650                record RootPropertyGetter(String prefix, boolean search) implements PropertyGetter<String> {
1651
1652                        // @Override
1653                        private @Nullable String valueOrNull(LogProperties props, String key) {
1654                                if (search) {
1655                                        return props.search(prefix, key);
1656                                }
1657                                return props.valueOrNull(fullyQualifiedKey(key));
1658                        }
1659
1660                        private <T> @Nullable T valueOrNull(LogProperties props, String key,
1661                                        BiFunction<LogProperties, String, @Nullable T> func) {
1662                                if (search) {
1663                                        return props.search(prefix, key, func);
1664                                }
1665                                return func.apply(props, fullyQualifiedKey(key));
1666                        }
1667
1668                        <T> Result<T> get(LogProperties props, String key, BiFunction<LogProperties, String, @Nullable T> func) {
1669                                var v = valueOrNull(props, key, func);
1670                                if (v == null) {
1671                                        return missingResult(props, List.of(key));
1672                                }
1673                                return new Result.Success<>(v);
1674                        }
1675
1676                        @Override
1677                        public Result<String> get(LogProperties props, String key) {
1678                                var v = valueOrNull(props, key);
1679                                if (v == null) {
1680                                        return missingResult(props, List.of(key));
1681                                }
1682                                return new Result.Success<>(v);
1683                        }
1684
1685                        @Override
1686                        public String propertyString(String value) {
1687                                return value;
1688                        }
1689
1690                        <T> Result.Error<T> errorResult(LogProperties props, String key, Exception e) {
1691                                String resolvedKey = props.description(fullyQualifiedKey(key));
1692                                String message = "Error for property. key: '" + resolvedKey + "', " + e.getMessage();
1693                                return new Result.Error<>(resolvedKey, message, e);
1694                        }
1695
1696                        <T> Result.Missing<T> missingResult(LogProperties props, List<String> keys) {
1697                                List<String> resolvedKeys = describeKeys(props, keys);
1698                                String message = "Property missing. keys: " + resolvedKeys;
1699                                return new Result.Missing<>(message);
1700                        }
1701
1702                        List<String> describeKeys(LogProperties props, List<String> keys) {
1703                                return keys.stream().map(k -> props.description(fullyQualifiedKey(k))).toList();
1704                        }
1705
1706                        /**
1707                         * Will search with prefix.
1708                         * @param prefix prefix.
1709                         * @return new property getter.
1710                         */
1711                        public RootPropertyGetter withSearch(String prefix) {
1712                                return new RootPropertyGetter(prefix, true);
1713                        }
1714
1715                        /**
1716                         * Will prefix key.
1717                         * @param prefix prefix.
1718                         * @return new property getter.
1719                         */
1720                        public RootPropertyGetter withPrefix(String prefix) {
1721                                return new RootPropertyGetter(prefix, search);
1722                        }
1723
1724                        @Override
1725                        public String fullyQualifiedKey(String key) {
1726                                return concatKey(prefix, key);
1727                        }
1728
1729                        /**
1730                         * An integer property getter.
1731                         * @return getter that will convert to integers.
1732                         */
1733                        public PropertyGetter<Integer> toInt() {
1734                                return new FuncGetter<>(this, Integer::parseInt, String::valueOf);
1735                        }
1736
1737                        /**
1738                         * A boolean property getter.
1739                         * @return getter that will convert to boolean.
1740                         */
1741                        public PropertyGetter<Boolean> toBoolean() {
1742                                return new FuncGetter<>(this, Boolean::parseBoolean, String::valueOf);
1743                        }
1744
1745                        /**
1746                         * A Map property that will use {@link LogProperties#mapOrNull(String)}.
1747                         * @return getter that will convert string property to a Map.
1748                         */
1749                        public PropertyGetter<Map<String, String>> toMap() {
1750                                return new MapGetter(this);
1751                        }
1752
1753                        /**
1754                         * A list property that will use {@link LogProperties#listOrNull(String)}.
1755                         * @return getter that will convert string property to a List.
1756                         */
1757                        public PropertyGetter<List<String>> toList() {
1758                                return new ListGetter(this);
1759                        }
1760
1761                        /**
1762                         * An enum property getter using {@link Enum#valueOf(Class, String)}.
1763                         * @param <T> enum type.
1764                         * @param enumClass enum class.
1765                         * @return getter that will convert to enum type.
1766                         */
1767                        public <T extends Enum<T>> PropertyGetter<T> toEnum(Class<T> enumClass) {
